item.title: Central American Beaches Are Being Overrun With Local and Foreign Plastic
item.description: A study of plastic bottles washed up on the Pacific coast of Latin America has identified a double problem—a mass of local waste combined with long-traveling bottles from Asia.

item.title: The Black Market for Fake Science Is Growing Faster Than Legitimate Research, Study Warns
item.description: A small but growing number of academics are improperly taking credit for articles, citations, and authorships, allowing them to appear prestigious without having conducted their own research.

item.title: The Hyperflexible People Who May Help Unlock Better Sleep Apnea Treatments

item.title: EPA Employees Still in the Dark as Agency Dismantles Scientific Research Office
item.description: As the EPA moves to shut down the Office of Research and Development, leadership is unable to answer questions as basic as when it will close and how many will lose their jobs.
